Create long named objects (15+ characters)

Add this object to an attribute (referenced to this object)

h3. Expected Results
You should see the whole name
h3. Actual Results
Cannot see the whole name
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:


h3. Workaround
Make shorter names
fields.summary: Long similar Object names not distinguishable in object edit screen for Referenced Object Attributes

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently Insight Reports with placeholder functions like {{currentUser()}} doesn't treat it as placeholders. Unlike Jira dashboard where the {{currentUser()}} is considered in the gadget filter Insight only respects it when ran as an individual IQL.
h3. Suggested Solution
* We could have IQL'd gadgets instead of Insight Reports which dynamically can change the context of {{currentUser()}} like placeholders
h3. Workaround 
* Users create their own reports with the same IQL filter instead of one report being shared with multiple users. Obviously, depending on the scenario it can raise some scalability issues
* You can alternatively [Develop a new report type|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INSSERV/How+to+create+a+new+report+type] as a Jira plugin. But this would need development efforts
fields.summary: Make Insight Reports respect the placeholder currentUser()

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Import triggered before and while startup Insight indexing is running, creating duplicate objects.

Insight index consistency check and potential reindex would occur before the import event happens, but in rare and specific occasions, this does not happen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Not all circumstances of successful reproduction are known, but the general steps to reproduce this are:
 # Stop Jira node where Insight is installed, making sure the Insight cache is not stored on shutdown (or the Insight cache has been deleted before the startup).
 # Start Jira
 # During the startup, a scheduled import task starts to run
 # Insight re-indexing kicks in

h3. Expected Results

Re-indexing is done first, then the imports can start executing afterwards.

Logs excerpt:
 * The latest occurrence of the problem in the logs is visible during Jira startup. We see the Insight cache / index is not present:
{noformat}
2021-04-27 04:06:22,774 InsightLauncherThread WARN anonymous     [i.r.i.index.model.InsightPersistedIndexManager] Insight Object Cache file not found /data/application/jira/caches/insight_indexes/objectschema
2021-04-27 04:06:22,774 InsightLauncherThread WARN anonymous     [i.r.i.index.model.InsightPersistedIndexManager] Insight Object Cache file not found /data/application//jira/caches/insight_indexes/objecttype
2021-04-27 04:06:22,774 InsightLauncherThread WARN anonymous     [i.r.i.index.model.InsightPersistedIndexManager] Insight Object Cache file not found /data/application/jira/caches/insight_indexes/objecttypeattribute
2021-04-27 04:06:22,774 InsightLauncherThread WARN anonymous     [i.r.i.index.model.InsightPersistedIndexManager] Insight Object Cache file not found /data/application/jira/caches/insight_indexes/objects
2021-04-27 04:06:22,774 InsightLauncherThread WARN anonymous     [i.r.i.index.model.InsightPersistedIndexManager] Insight Object Cache file not found /data/application/jira/caches/insight_indexes/objectConnection
...
2021-04-27 04:06:23,295 InsightLauncherThread WARN anonymous     [c.r.j.p.i.services.core.InsightIndexServiceImpl] Integrity check failed, number of objects mismatched, database: 196277, index: 0
...
{noformat}

 * At similar timing, we see the import job kicks in, which is kind of unexpected since Insight cache consistency hasn't been yet verified:
{noformat}
2021-04-27 04:06:25,731 [Caesium-1-4] | ============ Start import of module type rlabs-import-type-json, importSourceId: 137, number of sequential steps: 6 at time 2021-04-27T02:06:25.731Z
2021-04-27 04:06:25,820 [Caesium-1-4] | Started import in new thread, importSourceId: 137
2021-04-27 04:06:25,823 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-0] | 18.) xxx >>> Starting import 18.) xxx with id 137 of type rlabs-import-type-json with number of workers 12 at time 2021-04-27T04:06:25.823
2021-04-27 04:06:25,826 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-0] | 18.) xxx >>> Number of enabled ImportSourceOTs: 1
2021-04-27 04:06:25,832 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-0] | Updating missing objects for object type 1 with object type attribute to update: ObjectTypeAttributeBean [id=2142, name=xxx, type=DEFAULT, defaultType=TEXT], with newValue yyy
2021-04-27 04:06:25,834 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-0] | 18.) xxx >>> Number of enabled ImportSourceOTs: 1
2021-04-27 04:06:25,867 [insight-InsightImportThreadGroup-worker-thread-1] | 18.) xxx >>> Started reading data for configured object type id 1
2021-04-27 04:06:25,873 [insight-InsightImportThreadGroup-worker-thread-1] | >>> readDataToTable()...
2021-04-27 04:06:25,873 [insight-InsightImportThreadGroup-worker-thread-1] | import from: url
2021-04-27 04:06:25,873 [insight-InsightImportThreadGroup-worker-thread-1] | url: file:///data/application/jira/import/insight/file.json
2021-04-27 04:06:25,873 [insight-InsightImportThreadGroup-worker-thread-1] | fileId: null
2021-04-27 04:06:25,929 [insight-InsightImportThreadGroup-worker-thread-1] | <<< readDataToTable().
2021-04-27 04:06:25,936 [insight-InsightImportThreadGroup-worker-thread-1] | 18.) xxx >>> Completed reading data for configured object type id 1 in 69 ms
2021-04-27 04:06:25,939 [insight-InsightImportThreadGroup-worker-thread-1] | 18.) xxx >>Using memory backed import for import source object type 148
2021-04-27 04:06:25,939 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-0] | 18.) xxx >>> Fetched all data locators from external source in 102 ms
2021-04-27 04:06:26,163 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-0] | 18.) xxx >>> Mapped all data to internal objects in 222 ms
2021-04-27 04:06:26,192 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-0] | 18.) xxx >>> Decided actions for all objects in 29 ms
2021-04-27 04:06:26,193 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-0] | 18.) xxx >>> Objects to import 1035
{noformat}

 * Then, as the import is running, it logs errors due to missing data from the index and since Insight is currently indexing, but in the end, it will still create new and duplicated objects:
{noformat}
2021-04-27 04:06:30,365 [insight-InsightImportThreadGroup-worker-thread-10] | Failed to create new object: test (null), ObjectTypeId: 1, Attributes: (AttributeTypeId: 2, value(s):[null(value0)],AttributeTypeId: 13, value(s):[null(value1)],AttributeTypeId: 2142, value(s):[null(value2)],AttributeTypeId: 2143, value(s):[null(value3)],AttributeTypeId: 2144, value(s):[null(value4)]), avatar: false with actions: [CREATE] due to InsightRuntimeException: java.lang.NullPointerException; nested exception is: null
2021-04-27 04:06:30,527 [insight-InsightImportThreadGroup-worker-thread-10] | Failed to create new object: value5 (null), ObjectTypeId: 1, Attributes: (AttributeTypeId: 2, value(s):[null(value6)],AttributeTypeId: 13, value(s):[null(value7)],AttributeTypeId: 2142, value(s):[null(value8)],AttributeTypeId: 2143, value(s):[null(value9)],AttributeTypeId: 2144, value(s):[null(value10)]), avatar: false with actions: [CREATE] due to InsightLockedException: Action not possible while Insight is indexing
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results

Import starts before the indexing, and at some point, they will run concurrently. Since Import relies on the data from the index, missing or corrupted index will cause the import task to create duplicated objects.

Import triggered before and while startup reindexing procedure is running, creating duplicate objects.
h3. Workaround
 * Make sure Insight index (cache) is stored before Jira triggers "force shutdown" command - refer to [this guide|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INSSERV/Installation+Guide] that explains how to do this.
 * Otherwise, manually copy the index as follows:
 ## In Jira, go to settings > Apps > Manage apps > Indexing Insight > Persist Insight Index to file
 ## Copy the index directory ($JIRA_HOME/caches/insight_indexes) to a backup location
 ## Before the next Jira startup event, restore the copied index directory over the existing one.

h3. Notes

So far, we have seen this behaviour only during startup event. It does not happen regularly, but only under rare and specific circumstances. However, it not yet known whether this behaviour can occur while Insight indexing and import are running outside a startup event (i.e. while Jira and Insight are running and import / index are supposed to kick in).
fields.summary: Import triggered before and while startup Insight indexing is running, creating duplicate objects

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 * Set up a Jira instance, such as 8.13.1

 * Create a new Insight object schema
 * From this new schema, create a new CVE import and synchronize it - this will create a lot of objects
 !CVE Import.png|thumbnail! 

h4. On Confluence side
 * Install Insight for Confluence app
 * Configure an Insight Macro to use the newly created application link (System / Manage Apps, select Insight Macro and click configure)
 * Create a new page and insert the Insight Macro.
 * In the macro configuration, select the Insight schema you just created

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

SLA is not displayed for existing issues if JQL using Customer Request Type
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create support request with Get IT help customer request type
 # Create SLA condition

!image-2021-05-19-14-00-20-298.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

SLA displayed properly
h3. Actual Results

SLA is empty. If the customer creates a new ticket, SLA is shown properly.
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-19 at 13.58.14.png|thumbnail!

Reconstruct API is not solving the issue.
 - [Missing or corrupted SLA data in Jira Service Management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/missing-or-corrupted-sla-data-in-jira-service-management-828790603.html]

h3. Workaround

Customer Request Type values follow the format of "key/lowercased-form-title-hyphenated". Use this format in JQL instead.
 For example project key of "IT":
{code:java|title=JQL example}
"Customer Request Type" = "it/getithelp"{code}
Get the full list of request types + string value for each project:
{code:java|title=postgres}
SELECT p.pname, r."NAME" as request_type_name , (po."KEY" || '/' || r."KEY") AS request_type_key 
FROM "AO_54307E_VIEWPORT" po, "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM" r, project p 
WHERE po."ID"=r."VIEWPORT_ID" AND po."PROJECT_ID"=p.id
ORDER BY p.pname{code}
fields.summary: SLA is not displayed for existing issues if JQL using Customer Request Type

Service Management SLA reports do not respect issue security. A user could see an issue in the Service Management SLA report even if they can't browse it due to its security level. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a security scheme with a level that hides an issue from userA
 # Create a Service Management project and assign the security scheme to it
 # Display an SLA report that contains one issue from userA

h3. Expected Results
The report shouldn't show the issue to the user if they can't see it due to its security leve. 
h3. Actual Results
The issue is visible in the report. When the user clicks it, they're presented with the message that they can't browse it.
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing an Insight object loaded from a custom field via the Java api, the method getObjectAttributeBeans() does not return Attribute beans of the type text area.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new custom field of any insight type.
# Fill it with an object that has a text area attribute.
# Then get the value as a (mutable) objectbean with Insight JAVA API:
ex:
{code:java}
((issue.getCustomFieldValue(customFieldManager.getCustomFieldObject(10145)) as List<*>).firstOrNull() as MutableObjectBean)
{code}

h3. Expected Results
This objectBean should include all attributes.
h3. Actual Results
This objectBean will not include all attributes.

h3. Workaround

As clarified by Insight devs this happen because *textarea* attribute is not set on indexed when newly created.

To workaround the issue edit the settings for the attribute textarea and flag it as indexed:
 !Screenshot 2021-05-04 at 10.45.12.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Insight JAVA API method getObjectAttributeBeans() does not return Attribute beans of the type textarea when loading the object from custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Bulk print Insight labels operation crash with Oracle Jira DB

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Jira Oracle database create a label template in one of the Insight object schemas
 # Make sure to leave the description of the template empty:
 !Screenshot_2021-05-14_at_14_24_24.png|thumbnail! 
 # Save the template and go back to object schema.
 # In one object type which contains objects, select Bulk>Print Labels:
 !Screenshot 2021-05-14 at 14.28.42.png|thumbnail! 
 # Select the labels template just created and clic on Print:
  !Screenshot 2021-05-14 at 14.25.31.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The print preview with labels should appears.
h3. Actual Results
The operation spin indefinitely and the operation is not completed.
Nothing is into logs.

This happen because Oracle threat empty values as null.

Note that this happen with Insight 8.7.9 and latest 8.7.10 (so also with versions on Jira Server not only DC).

h3. Workaround

Fill the description in the template with a value.
fields.summary: Bulk print Insight labels operation crash with Oracle Jira DB

Customers receives repeated CAPTCHA loop prompts on sign up page for a Jira Service Desk Portal account

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight IQL search gives wrong result when using "!=" and "NOT IN" operators.

This happens when using an attribute name of type "Text", and that same attribute name is defined as a Boolean type somewhere else (e.g. on another schema).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Schema A, create an attribute called "Inactive" (Type: Default, Type Value: Boolean)
 ** Create several objects in Schema A, assign some values to "Inactive" attribute.
 # In Schema B:
 ** Create an attribute "Inactive" (Type: Default, Type Value: Text)
 ** Create 3 new objects, assign value "Yes" to "Inactive" attribute to 2 objects
 ** Switch to Objects view > Advanced search > enter one of the following two IQL searches and perform the search:
{code:java}
"Inactive" NOT IN ("Yes"){code}
{code:java}
"Inactive" != Yes{code}

h3. Expected Results

The IQL query should return objects that do not have the attribute value set to "Yes", example for "Test" attribute:
 !image-2021-05-12-09-59-36-237.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The IQL query returns objects having attribute value equal to "Yes" and all other values:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

If possible:
 * Rename one of the attributes (e.g. "User Inactive", if the object type is "User")
 * Rename the attribute to being with lower-case letter (i.e. "inactive")
 * Use other IQL operators to find what you are looking for (i.e. "Inactive" IN ("value1", "value2",...)
fields.summary: Insight IQL search gives wrong result when using "!=" and "NOT IN" operators

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 16 August 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

Insight Asset Management is [bundled with Jira Service Management (JSM)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagement/jira-service-management-4-15-x-release-notes-1043891577.html#JiraServiceManagement4.15.xreleasenotes-insight] as a core part of the product. We continue to deepen the integration of Insight with JSM and do not have plans to provide the ability to disable the feature.

Insight provides powerful asset and configuration management capabilities that lets you create and manage your IT and business assets, and interact with them through requests, incidents, changes, and more. Whether it’s hardware, software, or office equipment, you can see everything you own at a glance and categorise it in a clear way. These capabilities are a cornerstone of IT Service Management (ITSM), a market where we continue to see strong momentum.

We hope that you appreciate our candid and transparent communication. Please visit our product documentation to learn more about [getting started with Insight|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/getting-started-with-insight-1044784303.html].

Kind regards,

Charlie

Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center
{panel}

Hey Team,

Greetings for the day, hope you are doing great..!!!

Customers would like to have an option in the GUI (manage apps) to disable the recently bundled plugins like Insight, Advanced Roadmaps for users if they don't prefer to use them. 

Currently the option to disable these plugins is not available and hence the customers need to go through REST API based approach or database updates (pluginstate table) which needs manual intervention. Hence it will be great, if we can offer this flexibility to customers to choose whether they prefer to use these plugins (if not can disable in GUI itself). 

Thank you for the help in advance.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using basic search to filter the attribute values, some values are not listed if
 * there are at least 2 object types referencing the same object and this object type/attribute is created/updated later than another one
 * very few objects are assigned with the value(s) (< 1%)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

(i) In order to reproduce this, we need a big amount of data. An easy way to reproduce this is by using the NVD data.
 # Set up NVD integration as per [this documentation|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INVDI/Setting+up+Insight+NVD+Integration] and sync from the CVE-2020 database.
 # The Product object type will have 7000+ objects created.
 # Create another object type (e.g. Variants), create 3 objects (e.g. u1, u2, u3).
 # Add an attribute to the Product object type referencing Variants.
 # Assign 5 objects of Product with u3 and 30 objects with u1. Assign all other objects with u2.
 # In the object schema search page for Product, use basic search and select to filter by Variants. We'll see all 3 values of Variants appear in the list.
 # Now we need a second object type referencing Variants too. To make this simple, we can create another object type (e.g. Application) and import another 7000+ objects again from the CVE database (or CSV import).
 # Add an attribute to the Application object type referencing Variants.
 # Assign 5 objects of Application with u3 and 30 objects with u1. Assign all other objects with u2.
 # In the object schema search page for Application, use basic search and select to filter by Variants.
 # Note that only option U2 with lot of occurrences will show up:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

(!) It was also noticed the same problem occurs when an attribute is referring to Jira Groups (with non-standard groups) and it is used in the Basic Filter. When the Object Type has a huge amount of assets, the Basic Filter does not list all possible Groups.
h3. Expected Results

As long as there's at least one object with the attribute value, the value should show up in the basic search list of both object types (Product and Application)
h3. Actual Results
 * In the search for Product, all 3 options (u1, u2, and u3) are shown in the list
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
 * In the search for Application, only the option(s) with the majority of occurrences are shown. With the steps above, only U2 is shown.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 * If you type U1 or U2, the option will become available

h3. Workaround
 # Use the advanced search; or
 # Type in the value in the basic search field (it may fail in some cases as well)
fields.summary: Insight search does not show all available attributes options depending on values distribution

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to Bulk Edit a set of issues to set or change a custom field of type *Insight Object/s*.

Currently, using Insight 8.7.10, I can see the field in the Bulk Edit screen but the menu is empty and I cannot set it in any way.

I raised a support issue and I was told that this is the expected behavior currently, because:

{quote}
Unfortunately, the currentProject() placeholder (as well as ${pid} ) works within a
Project context. Hence it cannot work with the bulk edit - as the Bulk action has no
specific Project Context - you may Bulk Edit Issues of different Projects at the same
time...

You will note that when you create an issue, you can see the project in the form but
this is not the case for the bulk edit screen. The bulk edit action for Jira issues is not
bound to a specific project so the placeholder will return no value and there will be
no Object available for selection...
{quote}

I understand that there is an underlying logic difficulty here. But wouldn't it be possible to make the placeholder bound to a particular project *if* all the issues affected by the bulk edition belonged to a single project? This would be good enough for most of my needs.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Make it possible to Bulk Edit Insight fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As the Insight Apps from the Marketplace are phased out and replaced with Atlassian's built-in plugins, Jira Server/DC admins who are not moving to cloud need information on their upgrade paths.

We have full process documentation for [moving from Insight Apps to the Jira Cloud built-in Insight|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/import-a-csv-file-into-insight/] (and [vice versa|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/migrate-insight-cloud-to-insight-in-jira-service-management/]), but there is no parallel document to these migration instructions for teams who need to move from Jira Software, Core, or JSM's Apps to the built-in versions.

We would like to see documentation for this process. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit product documentation for [moving from Insight Apps to the Jira Cloud built-in Insight|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/import-a-csv-file-into-insight/].
 # Click the button in the top right to see the Data Center & Cloud version, and select a version.

h3. Expected Results

There is a page explaining how to switch over when ready.
h3. Actual Results

No page is found that explains how to migrate/upgrade.
h3. Workaround

The actual migration process is essentially automatic, but the workaround for not having a documented process is to ask a SME. As far as I know, the process is:
 * If Jira is upgraded to version 8.15+, you will need a JSM license to use the built-in App
 ** (The marketplace app will still work on Jira 8.15+ if not using JSM, until discontinued in Feb 2023)
 * If Jira is upgraded to version 8.15+ and you *do* have a JSM license,:
 ** Jira will enable the new built-in plugin automatically.
 ** Jira will disable the old Marketplace App when the new built-in plugin is enabled.
 ** No migration of data or assets is required, the data tables will be compatible and will work in place.
fields.summary: info on switching from Insight App for Jira Server/DC to built-in Insight in JSM

Currently we have only date range functions which helps us filter the data based on relative dates and not specific to dates and months. Hence this is one of the important requirements.

h4.Workaround:

<Please suggest or update the workaround if customers can readily make use of this unless the feature is part of the application>.

fields.description:
h3. 
Export an object with an attribute of type User with the User friendly format. The exported value of the user will be represented with the full name. If we use Data consistent format instead, some users will be represented with their userkey that looks like JIRAUSER12345 and some users with their username.
 !image-2021-05-06-19-01-23-943.png|thumbnail! 

This is due to the export uses userkey of Users. And officially since 8.4, newly created users have their userkey different from username, which is in the format of JIRAUSER<number>. Existing users still have their userkey=username and hence, after Jira upgrade, we'll see a different types of userkeys.

h3.
Use username instead of userkey for object export, or allow this to be configured somewhere
fields.summary: Use username instead of userkey for Insight object export

 # Change the issue in a way that a new SLA transition would be created.

h3. Expected Results

Transition occurs normally, with no errors in the log.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.metric.DateTimeRangeException: com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.metric.DateTimeRange - the START time of the DateTimeRange (2021-03-29T16:45:18.812Z) must be less than or equal to the STOP time (2021-03-29T16:44:53.734Z)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.metric.DateTimeRange.<init>(DateTimeRange.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.model.Timeline.getRanges(Timeline.java:136)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.model.Timeline.getPausedRanges(Timeline.java:81)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.metric.TimeMetricCalculationServiceImpl.getElapsedTime(TimeMetricCalculationServiceImpl.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.goal.GoalCalculationServiceImpl.calculateRemainingTime(GoalCalculationServiceImpl.java:160)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

ServiceDesk reports are showing results one month before for e.g. April in March drill down
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Data needs to be collected over many months to see the inconsistencies
 # Check the operating system timezone
 # Ensure any user's/agent's profile timezone is *_behind_* the operating system timezone
 # Navigate to Service desk Reports
 # Select 'Past year by month' in the dropdown menu
 # For e.g. April month results are shown for March

(i) Unable to replicate locally. But, customer is able to replicate on every occurrence. Below is the test cases provided by them:
{quote}In Europe timezone, Ok for GMT+0, or GMT+1, but bug for GMT+2, GMT+3, GMT+4 (at Bucharest, Helsinki, Istanbul, or Moscow). No problem for other time zone (Australia, America, Pacific, even in Africa with GMT+2, no problem).
{quote}
h3. Expected Results

Jira should not show incorrect reports one month before for e.g. April in March drill down
h3. Actual Results

ServiceDesk reports are showing results one month before for e.g. April in March drill down 
h3. Workaround

This workaround may fix some but not all instances affected by this bug.

When the operating system timezone is _*behind*_ the timezone set in the Jira user's profile (which may actually be the Jira default if they haven't changed it). Being behind the system causes the label to be incorrect, which is why they appear to be in the wrong month

Users can fix this discrepancy by either changing their own timezone ([via their JIRA profile|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/choosing-a-time-zone-720416101.html]) or the operating system timezone, as long as they match. Customers may need to quit and re-open their browsers before the changes take effect
